ANDREW HUBERMAN: Welcome
to Huberman Lab Essentials,

where we revisit past
episodes for the most

potent and actionable
science-based tools

for mental health, physical
health, and performance.
[MUSIC PLAYING]

My name is Andrew
Huberman, and I'm

a professor of neurobiology
and ophthalmology
at Stanford School of Medicine.

This podcast is separate from
my teaching and research roles
at Stanford.

Today, we're talking
all about emotions.

Emotions are central to our
entire experience of life.

Whether or not we're
happy or sad or depressed
or angry is our life experience.

And yet, I think with
all the importance

that we've placed on

And I mentioned brain and body

emotions really capture the
brain body relationship.

We cannot say that emotions

The other thing
about emotions is

that there's no real
agreement as to what's

This is a conversation that
